net.jodah.failsafe

Class DelayablePolicy<S,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jodah.failsafe.PolicyListeners<S,R>
      • net.jodah.failsafe.FailurePolicy<S,R>
        • net.jodah.failsafe.DelayablePolicy<S,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - self type
    R - result type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Policy<R>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CircuitBreaker, RetryPolicy

    public abstract class DelayablePolicy<S,R>
extends FailurePolicy<S,R>
    A policy that can be delayed between executions.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DelayablePolicy() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected Duration computeDelay(ExecutionContext context)
      Returns a computed delay for the result and context else null if no delay function is configured or the computed delay is invalid.
      DelayFunction<R,? extends Throwable> getDelayFn()
      Returns the function that determines the next delay before allowing another execution.
      S withDelay(DelayFunction<R,? extends Throwable> delayFunction)
      Sets the delayFunction that computes the next delay before allowing another execution.
      <F extends Throwable>
      S      		 withDelayOn(DelayFunction<R,F> delayFunction, Class<F> failure)
      Sets the delayFunction that computes the next delay before allowing another execution.
      S withDelayWhen(DelayFunction<R,? extends Throwable> delayFunction, R result)
      Sets the delayFunction that computes the next delay before allowing another execution.

    • Method Detail

      • getDelayFn

        public DelayFunction<R,? extends Throwable> getDelayFn()
        Returns the function that determines the next delay before allowing another execution.
        See Also:
        withDelay(DelayFunction), withDelayOn(DelayFunction, Class), withDelayWhen(DelayFunction, Object)

      • withDelay

        public S withDelay(DelayFunction<R,? extends Throwable> delayFunction)
        Sets the delayFunction that computes the next delay before allowing another execution.
        Parameters:
        delayFunction - the function to use to compute the delay before a next attempt
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if delayFunction is null
        See Also:
        DelayFunction

      • withDelayOn

        public <F extends Throwable> S withDelayOn(DelayFunction<R,F> delayFunction,
                                           Class<F> failure)
        Sets the delayFunction that computes the next delay before allowing another execution. Delays will only occur for failures that are assignable from the failure.
        Type Parameters:
        F - failure type
        Parameters:
        delayFunction - the function to use to compute the delay before a next attempt
        failure - the execution failure that is expected in order to trigger the delay
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if delayFunction or failure are null
        See Also:
        DelayFunction

      • withDelayWhen

        public S withDelayWhen(DelayFunction<R,? extends Throwable> delayFunction,
                       R result)
        Sets the delayFunction that computes the next delay before allowing another execution. Delays will only occur for results that equal the result.
        Parameters:
        delayFunction - the function to use to compute the delay before a next attempt
        result - the execution result that is expected in order to trigger the delay
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if delayFunction or result are null
        See Also:
        DelayFunction

      • computeDelay

        protected Duration computeDelay(ExecutionContext context)
        Returns a computed delay for the result and context else null if no delay function is configured or the computed delay is invalid.
